name: Gradle
description: Build using a Gradle wrapper script
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes: Configuration of the SonarQube analysis was moved to the SonarQube extension, in task `Prepare Analysis Configuration`

inputs.name: wrapperScript
inputs.label: Gradle Wrapper
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Gradle Wrapper script.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which to run the Gradle build. If not specified, the repository root directory is used.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to TFS/Team Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Gradle build to TFS/Team Services. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in TFS/Team Services.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class Files Directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. Normally, classes under `build/classes/main` are searched, which is the default class directory for Gradle builds

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class Inclusion/Exclusion Filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail When Code Coverage Results Are Missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

inputs.name: gradleOpts
inputs.label: Set GRADLE_OPTS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the GRADLE_OPTS environment variable, which is used to send command-line arguments to start the JVM. The xmx flag specifies the maximum memory available to the JVM.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SonarQube or SonarCloud Analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a [SonarQube or SonarCloud analysis](http://redirect.sonarsource.com/doc/install-configure-scanner-tfs-ts.html) after executing the current goals. 'install' or 'package' goals should be executed first.

inputs.name: sqGradlePluginVersion
inputs.label: SonarQube Scanner for Gradle Plugin Version

options.applied: Use plugin applied in your build.gradle

inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube Gradle plugin version to use. Refer to https://plugins.gradle.org/plugin/org.sonarqube for all available versions.

inputs.name: checkstyleAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run Checkstyle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Checkstyle tool with the default Sun checks. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: findbugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run FindBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the FindBugs static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: pmdAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run PMD
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the PMD Java static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.
